item.title: Import pdf in Gimp under windows
item.dc:creator: roland0x
item.content:encoded: Taken from: http://paperworlds.papermakeit.com/index.php?topic=457.0 Gimp was born in Linux environment that includes a Ghostscript to edit pdf's. Unlikely, in Windows you don't find such script already installed. You have to follow these easy steps before installing Gimp: Download the last releases of GTK+ libraries and Gimp from www.gimp.org (the single file for Windows includes also the GTK+ libraries) Go to http://sourceforge.net/projects/ghostscript Look for package Ghostscript x.y Download a prepared Windows distribution (e.g. gs861w32.exe) Start the executable and follow the instructions of the installation procedure Copy the executable gswin32c.exe (not the gswin32.exe) from the directory c:/program files/gs/gs8.60/bin of the ghostscript installation to the Windows directory (e.g. c:\windows or c:\winnt). Install GIMP. If you get an error importing a pdf file, probably GIMP still doesn't know where the Ghostscript libraries are located. You can set an Environmental Variable into Windows following these steps: Open the Control Panel Double click on System icon Go to Advanced System Properties Click on Environment Variables Click on New button of System Variables Set Variable name: GS_PROG Set Variable value: C:\Program Files\gs\gs8.61\bin\gswin32.exe (check the version: 8.61, 8.62, etc.) Click on OK Click on OK Click on OK Restart GIMP

item.title: Battle: Los Angeles ::Updated::
item.dc:creator: roland0x
item.content:encoded: Since I haven't wrote anything in a while (I'm a really lazy busy person), I thought it would be nice to write some of my impressions on "Battle: Los Angeles" game. I haven't seen the film yet, so I'm looking at it from purely gamer viewpoint. Well first things first, Controls: I don't know who decided the default controls, but i had to remap some things, since they were quite unusable. Normally, in other FPS games, the aim function would be assigned to the Right Mouse Button. Here it was assigned to [E] button. Quite annoying and uncomfortable. I mean, generations of FPS have used RMB for aim function (if they didn't use it for secondary fire), gamers grew accustomed to this and it became somewhat standard, so why change it? Honestly, I don't know and I don't want to know. It's not a really big thing, but some of the more "casual" and "non informatics" players (like my father) wouldn't be able to change that (believe me, there are people like this - vide: my father). Second thing: cut scenes. I didn't like them. If they were done normally, not in this comic style, they would be pretty good. Like that they were too static for me. And I didn't like the style and colors creators used. Same goes for sound in them. Too dry, almost metallic, expressionless. I got feeling that or the voice actors were really bad, or they didn't pay them enough... In-game graphics: Well, nothing to say here. Nice, and pretty. Done right how it should be done. Audio: Well, not bad, but not awesome either. I'd say OK. Maybe sounds of the firearms a little too dry as for me. Music quite inaudible in the heat of combat, but I heard some string music in the background and it just had fit. Gameplay: Well, as it goes for the gameplay, it was nice experience. Game is quite dynamic, full of combat, so the player don't get bored. But there is one thing that stings me a lot. The game is way too short. I know the games today are generally shorter than older games, but this game was surprisingly short. I managed to finish it in 1 hour, playing on the Hard difficulty. Some demo versions are longer than this. Second thing is that after the end it leaves You with "and then?" feeling. The story isn't finished, the war is not over and we don't know who wins, and what happens to protagonists. Anyway, it was a nice game. Too short, true, but still nice. Good as a break between Bulletstorm and Homefront. But I think it should be distributed, not as a stand alone product, but rater as free film promo material, or a film DVD special content. Selling game that is shorter than some game demo versions is plain blasphemy for me. Oh, is it only my feeling, or do I use the word "well" too often? --Update 01- 04-2011-- Ok, so I got curious and tried to watch the movie. Yeah, tried, not watched, since I only managed to see something like 10mins. After those i quit. Why? I don't have seen more horrible movie. It was awful. CG sucked, actor play was dull, and it had (as for those 10 mins) nothing to do with film. Looking now at the film and at the game, I think the game could be worth some money. At least it keeps higher quality level than the film...

item.title: Ebay hunting.
item.dc:creator: roland0x
item.content:encoded: Just a little note. Every time You want to buy something on e-bay, check if it is available in other country for a lower price, and if it can be shipped to your country and how much it will cost. Sometimes You can get this way item You are searching for for a less money. I forget about this and instead of buying MOBO for my old laptop for something like 30£ in england (33€) i bought it for 90€ in Italy where I live. I paid three times what i would pay in England... shit.

(Powinienem wziąć znów broń?) [Chorus] Condemns for darkness, pain And soul breaks in half when heat of yearning is near country like this, everything Where are forgotten dreams? item.title: Afterfall - first thoughts.
item.dc:creator: roland0x
item.content:encoded:
I begun playing "Afterfall Insanity". Just a bunch of my opinions after playing it for 10 minutes.
  1. The camera is too damn close to protagonist
  2. Whole graphics is too fuzzy. Too much of blur effect for me.
  3. Audio: I'm playing english version and the actors sound just unprofessional.
  4. Leaving Polish names in the english version was a really bad idea.
  5. Combat: it's pretty annoying that our character can perform only one move. Besides whole system is too stiff.
  6. Actor play: this is damn unrealistic too. Their movements are just... wrong. Too artificial.
  7. Every text i heard up until now was really stiff. Unnatural.
  8. I like idea of the whole shelter being so big that it needs internal railway. This is something I was expecting from fallout vaults and I've never get.
